intro: Hyrtanandra scabra, commonly known as the rough hyrtanandra, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in open woodlands or along forest edges. Hyrtanandra scabra is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
